meanings.definition: To remove waste products from the blood by means of a dialysis machine.
meanings.sent1: The hospital dialyses patients with kidney problems.
meanings.sent2: She needs to dialyse three times a week to stay healthy.
meanings.sent3: The dialysis machine beeped loudly, surprising everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: His kindness acted as a dialysis machine, filtering out negativity from our conversations.
meanings.sent5: The doctor explained how the dialysis process works in simple terms.

meanings.sent1: He has to dialyse regularly to manage his condition.
meanings.sent2: Patients dialyse at the clinic to maintain their health.
meanings.sent3: The thought of dialysing made her nervous, but the nurses were reassuring.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to dialysing was like a daily ritual for better health.
meanings.sent5: The support group shared stories of their experiences while dialysing.

meanings.definition: To purify a liquid by passing it through a semipermeable membrane.
meanings.sent1: The lab technician will dialyse the solution to remove impurities.
meanings.sent2: They need to dialyse the water before it can be used for experiments.
meanings.sent3: The students were amazed by how the machine could dialyse the liquid so effectively.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to dialyse the tension in the room, making everyone feel at ease.
meanings.sent5: The filter acted as a dialysis membrane, separating the particles from the liquid.
